definition[0]: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true
example[0]: A state of emergency has been declared.
example[1]: Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt (=it has been officially stated that he cannot pay his debts).
example[2]: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain  (=officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain).
example[3]: The war was declared illegal by the International Court of Justice.
example[4]: The court declared that Brown’s case should be reviewed.
example[5]: Several countries wanted Antarctica to be declared a ‘world park’.
example[6]: The city was declared to be in a state of siege.
example[7]: I declare you man and wife.
definition[1]: to say publicly what you think or feel
example[9]: He declared his intention to stand for president.
example[10]: Carol held a press conference and declared that she was innocent.
example[11]: Edward declared himself angry and frustrated.
definition[2]: to state on an official government form how much money you have earned, what property you own etc
example[12]: All tips are counted as part of your earnings and must be declared.
definition[3]: to tell a customs official that you are carrying goods on which you should pay tax when you enter a country
definition[4]: to choose to end your team’s turn before all your players have batted
definition[5]: to make something known officially to the public
example[13]: Shares in the company, which declared a £216 million loss, fell 712p to 334p.
example[14]: Two dominant companies have declared major redundancy programmes in the course of restructuring.
definition[6]: to officially state that you are connected with something and that this might affect the decisions you make about it
example[15]: If a director is involved in any way with the contractor, he or she is required to declare his interest at the meeting of the board.
definition[7]: to state officially that a person or company is unable to pay all their debts
example[16]: The consequences of being declared bankrupt would be harsh and severe.
definition[8]: to state officially that you are unable to pay your debts
example[17]: The new law established a mechanism to declare bankruptcy.
definition[9]: to state whether or not you are accepting an OPTION that you hold
definition[10]: when a company declares a DIVIDEND, it says that it will pay a dividend to its shareholders
example[18]: Before declaring a dividend, the trustee must give notice of his intention to do so to all creditors.
definition[11]: to make an official statement saying how much money you have earned, what property you own etc
example[19]: A lot of childcare is in the black economy, with carers not declaring their cash payments.
example[20]: Rent received from the property must be declared for tax.
definition[12]: to formally say that something is done, open, closed etc
example[21]: I now declare this factory open.
example[22]: Anything else? No? Then I declare the meeting closed.
